page.title: 09THE COTTAGE HOSPITAL
page.content: Llandrindod Wells cottage hospital was originally built in 1881 but has since had further extensions built on. The hospital has four wards with a total of 84 beds.In addition to these it has a physiotherapy department, an X-ray room and a casualty out patient section. Each ward has a sister in charge with a number of nurses and helpers working with them.Some of the nurses and helpers are male, two of them work at night.The person in overall charge is Matron Roberts. The hospital is open for emergencies at all times.There is an operating theatre in which minor surgery is performed.All major operations are referred to the nearest general hospital.In addition the hospital employs a number of cleaning and catering staff.
